title: Sandro Tonali : Man United learn transfer fee for Newcastle maestro - Man United News And Transfer News
body_text:
Newcastle have set an asking price for Sandro Tonali after Manchester United exploded into the race for the 25-year-old midfielder, according to the latest report.
Red-hot transfer race
The Red Devils are prioritising an overhaul of their midfield – with two new recruits expected to arrive at Old Trafford this summer, given Casemiro will leave and doubts continue to swirl around Manuel Ugarte’s future.
The club’s first-choice target is understood to be Elliot Anderson, though competition will be fierce for the Nottingham Forest and England maestro.
Carlos Baleba – the Brighton enforcer United made overtures to sign last year – and Crystal Palace’s Adam Wharton are also high on the list. However, Tonali emerged as another key target to bolster the engine room yesterday in a surprise twist.
The Italy international joined Newcastle from AC Milan for £55 million in 2023, but was almost immediately banned for 10 months for breaching betting rules. However, he has shone since his return, demonstrating a complete skillset at the heart of Eddie Howe’s side.
Tonali’s contract at St James’s Park runs until 2029, with the option of an additional year. This puts the Magpies in a strong negotiating position for their prized asset.
Nonetheless, there were shockwaves across Tyneside at the end of January after speculation the player’s agent was actively talking to Arsenal about a switch to the Emirates.
The Premier League leaders are joined by Manchester City in their admiration of the Italian, while Serie A giant Juventus are also interested. Sources close to the midfielder indicate he is open to a return to his homeland.
However, United are prepared to jump the growing queue for Tonali with a much greater need for his services than either of their domestic rivals, and a much larger budget than their competition in Turin.
Newcastle set their price
Newcastle are understood to “value Tonali between £80m and £100m,” as per talkSPORT – a significant profit on their initial investment.
The report states the Red Devils are “monitoring” the situation as they begin to solidify their plans this summer, with the prospect of Champions League football looking better by the week under interim head coach Michael Carrick. A return to Europe’s elite competition will prove decisive in United’s ability to compete with Arsenal and City for the 25-year-old midfielder, with his agent, Giuseppe Riso, revealing his desire to “lead” Newcastle into the Champions League next season.
“Newcastle are having a hard time letting go of Sandro, and he wants to lead the club to the Champions League. These transfer discussions will take place later. We’ll see how the season ends and then we’ll decide what to do,” Riso stated to Italian media.
“There’s no preference at the moment. It’s still early. What we’re saying today won’t apply tomorrow. Newcastle couldn’t let him go now, and there’s no point in moving, especially since Sandro is very attached to the club. We’ll evaluate and decide what to do in the summer.”
Final Thoughts
Tonali fits the profile United are looking to upgrade their midfield this summer, with an excellent pairing of physical and technical attributes, and zero concerns over how he will perform in the Premier League.
The club’s other targets will cost a similar amount – and the Italian has a more well-rounded skillset than Baleba or Wharton, though Anderson remains the gold standard for midfielders in England not called Declan Rice.
As such, an £80m raid on Newcastle would prove a bargain in the long run at Old Trafford, and would still be a good deal even if it creeped closer to the six-figures mark.
